Steam (ST): What, did you think I'd lend you my power and ask for nothing in exchange? I'll gladly assist a pair in love. And in exchange, I'll enjoy watching the cruel fate they'll eventually meet.
Umineko Project (UP): Did you think I would lend them that power without any compensation?{n}I'll lend a hand in love. And my compensation shall be one ticket to watch the cruel fate that the two of them will eventually meet.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Did I not lend them that power without asking for compensation? I'll lend a hand in love. So that as compensation, I can enjoy watching the cruel fate that the two of them will eventually meet.
PC Japanese (JP): 妾がその力を対価なく貸すことがあるとでも？　恋に手は貸そう。その対価は、やがて必ず訪れる二人への過酷な運命の鑑賞料としていただくわけよ。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "That is correct! Most witches who live for a thousand years get tired of life! In order to escape boredom, I adorn people's fates with fruit and brandy and cook them like cakes. I find humans dancing through oppressive fates inside an oven to be so very entertaining...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Precisely! Most witches who live for a thousand years get tired of life! In order to escape boredom, I adorn people's fates with fruit and brandy and cook them like cakes. I find humans dancing through oppressive fates inside an oven to be so very entertaining...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That is correct! Most witches who live for one thousand years get tired of living! In order to escape boredom, I adorn people's fates with fruit and brandy and cook them like cakes. I find humans dancing through oppressive fates inside an oven to be so very entertaining...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「その通り！　千年も生きると大抵の魔女は生き飽きる！　妾は退屈から逃れるために、人間たちの運命にブランデーや果物を練りこみ、ケーキのように焼き上げるのだ。オーブンの中で苛烈な運命に踊る人間たちの何と面白きこと…！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「その通り！　千年も生きると大抵の魔女は生き飽きる！　妾は退屈から逃れるために、人間たちの運命にブランデーや果実を練りこみ、ケーキのように焼き上げるのだ。オーブンの中で苛烈な運命に踊る人間たちの何と面白きこと…！」
Russian (RU): "Именно так! Большинство ведьм, проживших тысячу лет, устают от жизни! Чтобы избежать скуки, я украшаю судьбы людей фруктами с коньяком и пеку их, словно пирожные. Я нахожу людей, которым выпала тяжёлая судьба, довольно интересными!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Precisamente! A maioria das bruxas que vivem mil anos se cansam da vida! Para escapar do tédio, adorno os destinos das pessoas com frutas e conhaques e os cozinho como bolos. Ao meu ver, humanos dançando através de destinos opressivos dentro de um forno são verdadeiramente interessantes...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「正是如此！活過了千年，大多數魔女都會對生感到膩煩！妾身為了逃避煩悶，會將白蘭地與水果攪拌進人類的命運，然後就像烤蛋糕一樣將其烘焙至熟。在烤箱中被殘酷的命運擺佈得上躥下跳的人們，是何等地有趣啊…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「正是如此！活过了千年，大多数魔女都会对生感到腻烦！妾身为了逃避烦闷，会将白兰地与水果搅拌进人类的命运，然后就像烤蛋糕一样将其烘焙至熟。在烤箱中被残酷的命运摆布得上蹿下跳的人们，是何等地有趣啊…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Proprio così! Quasi tutte le streghe che vivono per un millennio si stancano di vivere! Per poter sfuggire alla noia, condisco i destini delle persone con frutta e brandy e li cucino come torte. Trovo che gli esseri umani che danzano attraverso un fato crudele in un forno siano assolutamente divertenti...!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Proprio così! Generalmente, le streghe che vivono per un millennio si stancano di vivere! Per poter sfuggire alla noia, condisco i destini degli umani con frutta e brandy, e li inforno come si farebbe con delle torte. Quanto sono divertenti gli umani che danzano all'interno di un forno, dirigendosi verso un fato crudele...!"
Turkish (TR): "Kesinlikle! Bin yıl yaşayan cadıların çoğu yaşamaktan sıkılır! Can sıkıntısından uzaklaşmak için insanların kaderlerini meyve ve konyakla süsleyip birer kek gibi pişiriyorum. İnsanların bir fırının içinde zalim kaderleriyle dans ediyor olmalarını oldukça eğlendirici buluyorum...!"

Steam (ST): However, he fully realized that this was a terrifying being who treated the fate of humans as a show, enjoying it whenever some harm befell them.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, he realized well enough that this was a terrifying being who treated the fate of humans as a show, enjoying it whenever some harm befell them.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、人間たちの運命をまるで見世物のように扱い、何かの危害を加えることで面白がっている恐ろしい存在であることは充分に理解できた。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，对于这魔女是个恐怖的存在这一点，他却是理解得不能再清楚了。她简直把人类的命运当成了戏剧，而且还会通过施加伤害来取乐。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, ben realizzava che questa donna era una creatura terrificante che trattava il fato degli umani come uno spettacolo, che la divertiva ogni volta che una qualche tragedia portava loro danno.

Umineko Project (UP): He had loved Shannon too dearly. ...And so, when Shannon was in pain, Kanon shared in that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He loved Shannon too dearly....Therefore, when Shannon was in pain, Kanon shared in that.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音を慕い過ぎた。…だから、紗音が苦しむ時、嘉音はそれを共有してしまうのだ。
Russian (RU): Он слишком сильно любил Шаннон. ...Поэтому когда Шаннон чувствовала боль, он разделял её с ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele amava Shannon de forma idolátrica. ...Por causa disto, quando Shannon sofria, Kanon compartilhava daquele sofrimento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他太敬慕紗音了。…所以，紗音感到痛苦的時候，嘉音也會共有這份痛苦。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他太敬慕纱音了。…所以，纱音感到痛苦的时候，嘉音也会共有这份痛苦。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lui voleva veramente tanto bene a Shannon. ... Pertanto, quando lei stava male, anche Kanon condivideva quel dolore.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Voleva veramente bene a Shannon... Pertanto, quando lei stava male, Kanon partecipava al suo dolore.
Turkish (TR): Shannon'u çok seviyordu. ...Ve bu nedenle, Shannon acı çektiğinde Kanon da acısını paylaşmıştı.

Steam (ST): If only Shannon had continued to live as furniture, indifferently like Kanon, without any regrets in this world, he wouldn't have had to be in so much pain...!
Umineko Project (UP): If only Shannon had continued to exist as furniture, living indifferently like Kanon, without any attachments to this world, they wouldn't have had to be in so much pain...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If only Shannon had continued to live as furniture, indifferently like Kanon, without any regrets in this world, he wouldn't have had to be in so much pain...!
PC Japanese (JP): もし紗音が家具でい続け、嘉音と同様にこの世に何の未練もなく淡々と生きてくれたなら、ここまで苦しまずに済んだ…！
Russian (RU): Если бы только Шаннон продолжила жить как мебель, в точности как Канон, без сожалений, ему бы не пришлось чувствовать такую боль!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se apenas Shannon tivesse continuado a existir como mobília, vivendo indiferentemente assim como Kanon, sem qualquer arrependimento neste mundo, eles não teriam que passar por tanta dor...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果紗音能一直是個家具，能和嘉音一樣不對這個世界抱有任何留戀，寡淡無欲地活著的話，就不會如此痛苦了…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果纱音能一直是个家具，能和嘉音一样不对这个世界抱有任何留恋，寡淡无欲地活着的话，就不会如此痛苦了…！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se solo Shannon avesse continuato a vivere come un mobile, indifferente come Kanon, senza nessun rimpianto in questo mondo, lui non avrebbe provato quel dolore...!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Se Shannon avesse continuato a restare un mobile, se avesse vissuto in maniera apatica come Kanon, senza alcun rimpianto nella propria vita, lui non avrebbe sofferto così tanto...!
Turkish (TR): Shannon keşke mobilya olarak varlığını sürdürmeye devam edip Kanon gibi kayıtsızca yaşasaydı, bu dünyayla hiçbir bağı olmasaydı, bu kadar acı çekmek zorunda kalmazlardı...!

Steam (ST): The witch planned to toy with Shannon, who had known the taste of love... no, whom she had taught the taste of love, ...as she killed her.
Umineko Project (UP): The witch planned to toy with Shannon, who had learned the taste of love—no, who she had taught the taste of love—as she killed her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The witch planned to toy with Shannon, who had known the taste of love..., no, who she had taught the taste of love, as she killed her.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女は、恋の味を覚えた…、いや、恋の味を教えた紗音を、弄びなぶり殺しにするつもりなのだ。
Russian (RU): Ведьма хотела поиграть с Шаннон, познавшей вкус любви... Нет, вкусившей любви с её помощью, а затем убить её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A bruxa planejava brincar com Shannon, que havia aprendido o sabor amor — não, a quem ela havia ensinado o gosto do amor — enquanto a matava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女是打算，將那懂得了戀愛滋味的紗音…，不，是將那被她教會了戀愛滋味的紗音，盡情玩弄至死。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女是打算，将那懂得了恋爱滋味的纱音…，不，是将那被她教会了恋爱滋味的纱音，尽情玩弄至死。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La strega aveva in programma di giocare con Shannon, che aveva conosciuto il gusto dell'amore... no, le aveva insegnato il gusto dell'amore, ed è come se l'avesse uccisa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La strega aveva in mente di giocare con Shannon, che aveva conosciuto il sapore dell'amore... no, a cui era stato insegnato il sapore dell'amore, e di torturarla a morte.
Turkish (TR): Cadı, aşkın tadını öğrenmiş olan—hayır, aşkın tadını öğrettiği—Shannon'u öldürürken onunla oynamayı planlıyordu.

Steam (ST): She wouldn't be welcomed into the Golden Land and granted a compassionate release. Instead, if the witch had her way, she'd be used as a sacrifice, subjected to the utmost of torture and pain, and forcibly turned into a human foundation for this evil ceremony...!
Umineko Project (UP): She would not invite her to the Golden Land as a merciful release, but would make her a sacrifice for that evil ritual, after dealing her the limits of torture and pain...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Being released along with her love meant that she wouldn't be invited to the Golden Land, but would become a human sacrifice for an evil ceremony, after receiving the limits of torture and pain...!
PC Japanese (JP): 慈しみのある解放として黄金郷に誘うのではなく、その為の生贄として、責め苦の限りを与え苦しめ抜き、邪悪な儀式の人柱にしようとしている…！
Russian (RU): Быть отпущенной вместе с её возлюбленным означало, что она не будет приглашена в Золотую Землю, а просто станет человеческой жертвой, принесенной в злом ритуале, познав пределы мучения и боли!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não a convidaria à Terra Dourada como forma de uma piedosa libertação, mas faria dela um sacrifício para aquela maligna cerimônia, depois de infligir a ela os limites da tortura e da dor...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女邀她進黃金鄉，並非是想要讓她獲得充滿慈愛的解放。而是想要將她作為這一儀式的活祭，在盡可能地折磨她，讓她飽受痛苦後，把她獻祭為邪惡儀式的生樁…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女邀她进黄金乡，并非是想要让她获得充满慈爱的解放。而是想要将她作为这一仪式的活祭，在尽可能地折磨她，让她饱受痛苦后，把她献祭为邪恶仪式的生桩…！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Essere rilasciata insieme al suo amore voleva dire che non sarebbe stata invitata nella Terra Dorata, ma sarebbe diventata un sacrificio umano per una cerimonia malvagia, dopo aver ricevuto il massimo della tortura e del dolore...!
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Invece di invitarla nella Terra Dorata come atto di liberazione compassionevole, l'avrebbe tormentata, infliggendole i peggiori supplizi, e avrebbe cercato di renderla un sacrificio umano per una cerimonia scellerata, in quanto lei era una pedina da sacrificare per i suoi scopi...!
Turkish (TR): Onu merhametli bir serbest bırakılış olarak Altın Diyar'a davet etmeyecek, işkence ve acının sınırlarını ona yaşattıktan sonra onu o şeytani ritüel için bir kurban haline getirecekti...!

Steam (ST): And this witch would probably make Shannon meet this horrible fate...for no reason other than that it was amusing to her.
Umineko Project (UP): And this witch would probably actually make Shannon meet this horrible fate, for no other reason than it would be interesting for her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And this witch would probably make Shannon actually meet this horrible fate for no reason other than that it was interesting to her.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、この魔女は、面白いからというだけの理由で、紗音を現実に恐ろしい目に遭わせるだろう。
Russian (RU): И ведьма, возможно, заставит Шаннон встретить эту ужасную судьбу лишь потому, что ей, ведьме, так интересней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E então, a bruxa provavelmente faria com que Shannon se deparasse com tal horrível destino...por nenhuma outra razão além desta, que era divertido para ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且，這位魔女恐怕還會僅僅以好玩為理由，讓紗音在現實裡遇上可怕的遭遇吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且，这位魔女恐怕还会仅仅以好玩为理由，让纱音在现实里遇上可怕的遭遇吧。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E questa strega l'avrebbe portata incontro a un destino veramente crudele, solamente perché lo trovava interessante...

Steam (ST): It was that simple. ...In the end, though he had tried to resist the witch and avoid pleasing her, he had only made things more amusing for her.
Umineko Project (UP): It was that simple. ...In the end, though he had tried resisting the witch to avoid pleasing her, he had only made things interesting for her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was that simple. ...In the end, though he had tried resisting the witch to avoid pleasing her, he had only made things interesting for her.

Turkish (TR): Bu kadar basitti. ...Nihayetinde, onu eğlendirmemek için cadıya direnmeye çalışsa da, işleri sadece onun için ilginç hale getirmişti.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……嘉音，……………弯下了单膝，选择了在魔女面前下跪…。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...Kanon... scelse di inchinarsi di fronte alla strega con entrambe le ginocchia...
Turkish (TR): ......Kanon...............tek dizinin üzerine çöktü ve cadının önünde saygıyla eğilmeyi seçti...

Steam (ST): It didn't matter what happened to himself.
Umineko Project (UP): He didn't care what happened to himself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It didn't matter what happened to himself.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分はどうなってもいい。
Russian (RU): Было не так важно, что станет с ним.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele não ligava para o que aconteceria consigo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 自己會怎麼樣都無所謂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 自己会怎么样都无所谓。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non importava cosa sarebbe successo a lui.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Non gli importava cosa sarebbe successo...
Turkish (TR): Kendisine ne olduğu umurunda değildi.

Steam (ST): ...However, ......the one thing he couldn't bear to see...... was Shannon, who had given him his only reason to live during his days as furniture, being toyed with like this...
Umineko Project (UP): ...However, ......just the fact that Shannon, who during his days as furniture had given him his only reason to live, was being toyed with, ......that alone was something that he couldn't overlook...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …でも、……家具の日々に、唯一自分に生きる理由を教えてくれた紗音が弄ばれることだけは、……それだけはどうしても見過ごすことができない…。
Russian (RU): ...Однако... Лишь тот факт, что с Шаннон, которая во времена его жития в качестве мебели, лишь одна давала ему причину, чтобы жить, играли, ......Это само по себе было тем, что он не мог проигнорировать...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Porém, ......a única coisa que ele não suportaria ver, era Shannon, quem durante seus dias de mobília deu a ele uma única razão para viver, ......ser manipulada de tal forma...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …但是，……唯有玩弄紗音——在身為家具的日子裡，只有她讓自己懂得了活著的理由——唯有這件事，……是他無論如何都沒法置之不理的…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …但是，……唯有玩弄纱音——在身为家具的日子里，只有她让自己懂得了活着的理由——唯有这件事，……是他无论如何都没法置之不理的…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia... anche solo il fatto che Shannon, che durante i suoi giorni come mobile gli aveva dato l'unica ragione di vita, venisse trattata come un giocattolo... anche solo quel fatto era qualcosa che lui non poteva sorvolare...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia... l'unica cosa che non poteva sorvolare... era che Shannon, la quale durante i suoi giorni da mobile gli aveva dato l'unica ragione di vivere... venisse trattata come un giocattolo...
Turkish (TR): ...Ancak, ......mobilya olarak çalıştığı günlerde, ona yaşamak için elindeki tek nedeni veren Shannon'la oynanıyor olması bile, ......tek başına görmezden gelemeyeceği bir şeydi...

Steam (ST): That was why... kissing the shoes of the witch...was an easy oath for Kanon to make.
Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, ......something like kissing the shoes of the witch...was an easy oath for Kanon to make.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore, ......something like kissing the shoes of the witch, ...was an easy oath for Kanon to make.
PC Japanese (JP): だから。……魔女の靴に口付けをすることなど、…嘉音にとっては安い誓い。
Russian (RU): Поэтому... Нечто вроде целования ведьминой обуви... Было простым подтверждением присяги для Канона.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, ......algo como beijar os sapatos da bruxa...era um juramento fácil para Kanon.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以。……親吻魔女靴子什麼的，…對嘉音來說算不了什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以。……亲吻魔女靴子什么的，…对嘉音来说算不了什么。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Pertanto... qualcosa come baciare le scarpe della strega... fu un giuramento facile da fare per Kanon.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Pertanto... baciare le scarpe della strega... per Kanon era un giuramento semplice...
Turkish (TR): Bu nedenle, ......Kanon için cadının ayakkabılarını öpmek gibi bir şey...kolay bir yemindi.

Steam (ST): ...When his quivering lips actually touched the witch's shoe...
Umineko Project (UP): ......At the time that his quivering lips actually touched the witch's shoe...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……震える彼の唇が、魔女の靴に確かに触れた時。
Russian (RU): ......В то время, как его дрожащие губы коснулись ведьминой обуви...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Na hora que seus trêmulos lábios chegaram a tocar o sapato da bruxa...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……他顫抖著的嘴唇，碰觸到魔女靴子之時。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……他颤抖着的嘴唇，碰触到魔女靴子之时。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Nel momento in cui le sue labbra tremolanti toccarono la scarpa della strega...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Nel momento in cui le sue labbra tremolanti toccarono effettivamente la scarpa della strega...
Turkish (TR): ......Titreyen dudakları cadının ayakkabısına değdiği anda...

Steam (ST): ...{f:5:Beatrice} let a look of ecstasy rise to her face, ...then laughed with a voice filled to bursting.
Umineko Project (UP): ...{f:5:Beatrice}, after allowing a look of ecstasy to rise to her face, ...let out an ear‐splitting laugh.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Beatrice, after letting a look of ecstasy rise to her face, ...laughed with a voice filled to bursting.
PC Japanese (JP): …ベアトリーチェは恍惚の眼差しを浮かべてから、はち切れんばかりの声で、…笑った。
Russian (RU): ...На лице {f:5:Беатриче} отразился бурный восторг... И она рассмеялась, рассмеялась, на пределе собственного голоса.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...{f:5:Beatrice}, depois de permitir que um olhar de êxtase subisse a seu rosto, ...soltou uma risada ensurdecedora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …貝阿朵莉切露出了一副心醉般的眼神，以快笑破喉嚨的聲音，…大笑了起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …贝阿朵莉切露出了一副心醉般的眼神，以快笑破喉咙的声音，…大笑了起来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Beatrice, dopo aver lasciato che una espressione di estasi le si formasse sul volto... rise a gran voce.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): {f:5:Beatrice}, dopo aver mostrato un'espressione di estasi sul suo volto... scoppiò in una grande risata.
Turkish (TR): ...{f:5:Beatrice} yüzünde bir coşku ifadesinin belirmesine izin verdikten sonra, ...kulak yırtıcı bir kahkaha attı.

Steam (ST): At that moment, the witch, who had grown bored of life after a thousand years, was completely filled with the evil emotion that she lived for...
Umineko Project (UP): In that moment, the witch who had tired of a thousand years of life was completely filled with the evil emotion that was her only raison d'être......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that moment, the witch, who had been bored of living after one thousand years, was completely filled with that evil emotion which was what she lived for......
PC Japanese (JP): それは千年を生き飽きた魔女が、唯一の生き甲斐とする邪悪な感情を満たされた、まさにその瞬間であった……。
Russian (RU): В этот момент, ведьма, которой наскучила тысячелетняя жизнь, оказалась полностью во власти тех дьявольских эмоций, которыми она жила всё это время...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele momento, a bruxa que havia se cansado de mil anos de vida foi completamente preenchida com a emoção maligna que era sua única razão para viver......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 活了千年，對生感到膩煩的魔女，滿足了她當成唯一生存意義的邪惡感情的瞬間，正是這一刻……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 活了千年，对生感到腻烦的魔女，满足了她当成唯一生存意义的邪恶感情的瞬间，正是这一刻……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In quel momento, la strega, che si era annoiata di vivere dopo mille anni, fu colma di quel sentimento malvagio per cui la sua vita aveva scopo...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): In quell'esatto istante, la strega, che si era stancata di vivere per mille anni, fu pervasa da un sentimento maligno, che costituiva il suo unico scopo di vita...
Turkish (TR): O anda, bin yıllık hayattan bıkmış olan cadı, yegane varoluş sebebi olan şeytani duygularla tamamen dolup taştı......

Steam (ST): When lunch ended, the relatives moved to the parlor.
Umineko Project (UP): Lunch had ended, and the relatives had moved to the parlor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When lunch ended, the relatives moved to the parlor.
PC Japanese (JP): 昼食を終えた親族たちは、客間に移っていた。
Russian (RU): Когда трапеза закончилась, родственники направились в гостиную.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O almoço havia chegado ao fim, e os parentes começaram a se locomover para a sala de visitas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 吃完午飯後的親族們移步去了客廳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 吃完午饭后的亲族们移步去了客厅。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando il pranzo finì, i parenti si spostarono nel salotto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopo aver finito di pranzare, i parenti si spostarono nel salotto.
Turkish (TR): Öğle yemeği bitmiş, akrabalar salona geçmişti.

Steam (ST): Rosa had bought a high-class brand of black tea from a famous store in Ginza. That had been served, and the parlor was filled with a pleasant aroma...
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa had bought a high‐class brand of black tea from a famous store in Ginza. That had been served, and the inside of the parlor was filled with a very nice aroma...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa had bought a high-class brand of black tea from a famous store in Ginza. That had been prepared, and the inside of the parlor was filled with a very nice aroma...
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座が銀座の名店で、高級な銘柄の紅茶を買ってきてくれた。それが振舞われ、客間の中はとても良い香りで満たされていた…。
Russian (RU): Роза купила и привезла с собой первоклассный сорт чёрного чая из знаменитого магазина в Гинзе. Он был уже заварен, и вся комната оказалась заполненной изысканным ароматом...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa havia comprado uma marca de chá preto de alta‐classe em uma famosa loja de Ginza. Esse mesmo chá foi servido, preenchendo o interior da sala de visitas com um agradável aroma...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座從銀座名店買來了高級的名牌紅茶。這茶被端上了席來，客廳之中注滿了十分美妙的茶香…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座从银座名店买来了高级的名牌红茶。这茶被端上了席来，客厅之中注满了十分美妙的茶香…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa aveva comprato una rinomata marca di tè nero da un famoso negozio a Ginza. Era stato preparato, e l'interno del salotto fu riempito da un aroma molto gradevole...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa aveva comprato una rinomata marca di té nero da un negozio di Ginza ben conosciuto. Venne servito a tutti, e il salotto venne pervaso da un aroma molto gradevole...
Turkish (TR): Rosa, Ginza'daki ünlü bir mağazadan birinci sınıf bir marka siyah çay almıştı. Çay servis edilmiş ve salonun içi çok güzel bir aromayla dolmuştu...

Steam (ST): Since the children were there too, the adults tried to interact like normal relatives on the surface, talking peacefully about recent events and how their children were growing up.
Umineko Project (UP): Since the children were together with the adults, the adults were, at least on the surface, interacting like relatives, talking peacefully about recent events and how their children were growing up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Since the children were together with the adults, the adults tried to interact like relatives on the surface, talking peacefully about recent events and how their children were growing up.
PC Japanese (JP): 大人たちは、子どもたちが一緒ということもあって、上辺だけは親族の交流らしく、近況や子育てなどについて和やかな話をしていた。
Russian (RU): Поскольку вместе со взрослыми в компании были и дети, взрослые пытались вести себя друг с другом как и подобает добрым родственникам, мирно обсуждая последние события и то, как выросли их дети.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como as crianças estavam juntas dos adultos, eles tentaram agir como parentes normais, ao menos na superfície, conversando pacificamente sobre eventos recentes e como seus filhos estavam crescendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於有小孩子們在場，因此大人們在表面上像普通親戚們之間的交流一樣，一團和氣地談論著各自近況和孩子們的教育。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于有小孩子们在场，因此大人们在表面上像普通亲戚们之间的交流一样，一团和气地谈论着各自近况和孩子们的教育。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che i ragazzi erano con gli adulti, questi provavano ad interagire in apparenza come parenti, parlando tranquillamente degli eventi recenti e su come stessero crescendo i loro figli.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dato che i ragazzi erano insieme agli adulti, questi ultimi all'apparenza interagivano tra loro come una famiglia normale, parlando in maniera affabile degli ultimi avvenimenti e su come stessero crescendo i loro figli.
Turkish (TR): Çocuklar yetişkinlerle birlikte olduğu için, yetişkinler en azından görünürde akrabalar gibi etkileşime giriyor, yakın zamandaki olaylar ve çocuklarının nasıl büyüdüğü hakkında barışçıl bir şekilde konuşuyorlardı.

Steam (ST): It had started raining, so the children couldn't do anything but sit here like this, watching TV, unable to go outside.
Umineko Project (UP): It had started raining outside, so the children were unable to go out, and had no choice but to sit here like this, watching TV.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had started raining outside, so the children couldn't do anything but sit here like this, watching TV, unable to go outside.
PC Japanese (JP): 外は雨になってしまったので、子どもたちは外へ遊びに行けず、こうして客間でテレビを見ているしかなかった。
Russian (RU): Дождь на улице продолжал лить как из ведра, поэтому детям ничего не оставалось, кроме как сидеть и смотреть телевизор, не помышляя о том, чтобы выйти на улицу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia começado a chover lá fora, por isso as crianças não puderam sair, e não tiveram escolha a não ser sentarem e assistirem TV.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 外面下起了雨，所以孩子們都沒法出去玩，只好像這樣在客廳看著電視。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 外面下起了雨，所以孩子们都没法出去玩，只好像这样在客厅看着电视。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Fuori iniziò a piovere, quindi i ragazzi non poterono far altro che sedersi là così, guardando la TV, non potendo uscire fuori.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dato che fuori stava piovendo, i ragazzi non erano usciti fuori a giocare, e non potevano far altro che guardare la TV in quel modo.
Turkish (TR): Dışarıda yağmur yağmaya başlamıştı, bu yüzden çocuklar dışarı çıkamadılar, ve burada öylece oturup televizyon izlemekten başka çareleri yoktu.

Steam (ST): Maria was apparently a TV kid, and she kept watching a boring daytime program without getting bored, giggling all by herself.
Umineko Project (UP): Like a true TV‐kid, Maria was watching vapid daytime programs one after another without getting bored, and was giggling all to herself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria continued watching a boring daytime program without getting bored, going kyakkya all by herself, like a TV kid.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞はテレビっ子らしく、飽きることなくお昼時の退屈な番組を見続け、きゃっきゃとひとり騒ぎ続けていた。
Russian (RU): Мария продолжала смотреть скучную дневную передачу, даже не скучая, продолжая повторять себе "кья‐кья", как образцовое дитя телевизора.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Maria, sendo uma garota que adorava televisão, estava assistindo a tediosos programas diurnos, um após o outro sem ficar entediada, enquanto ria sozinha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞似乎是個電視兒童，她不厭其煩地看著午間播出的無聊節目，嘰嘰喳喳地獨自歡鬧著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚似乎是个电视儿童，她不厌其烦地看着午间播出的无聊节目，叽叽喳喳地独自欢闹着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Maria continuò a guardare un programma giornaliero noioso senza mai stancarsi, facendo kyakkya da sola, come una bambina della TV.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Maria era una patita della televisione, e continuava a guardare i programmi noiosi dell'ora di pranzo senza stancarsi, facendo versetti tra sé e sé.
Turkish (TR): Maria, gerçek bir televizyon kurdu gibi, sıkılmadan birbiri ardına sıkıcı gündüz programlarını izliyor ve kendi kendine kıkırdıyordu.

Steam (ST): At first, Battler joined in, seeming to deepen his relationship with Maria, but he had gotten up early that morning and was gradually hit by a wave of drowsiness...
Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that Battler had joined in at first, deepening his relationship with Maria, but he had gotten up early that morning, and so was gradually attacked by waves of drowsiness...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At first, Battler joined in, apparently deepening his relationship with Maria, but he had gotten up early that morning, and was therefore attacked by a wave of drowsiness...
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人も最初はそれに加わり、真里亞との交流を深めていたようだが、朝が早かったこともあり、次第に眠気に襲われていった…。
Russian (RU): Сперва Баттлер присоединился к Марии, очевидно, чтобы укрепить свои отношения с ней, но он встал ранним утром, и поэтому его одолевали накатывающие волны сонливости...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que Battler havia se juntado de início, aprofundando seu relacionamento com Maria, mas por ter acordado cedo aquela manhã, ele foi gradualmente atacado por ondas de sonolência...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然戰人剛開始好像也加入了進去，加深了下和真里亞的交流，但他早上起得早，馬上就被陣陣睡意侵襲，打起了哈欠…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然战人刚开始好像也加入了进去，加深了下和真里亚的交流，但他早上起得早，马上就被阵阵睡意侵袭，打起了哈欠…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): All'inizio, Battler si unì, apparentemente approfondendo la sua relazione con Maria, ma quella mattina si era svegliato presto, e quindi fu colto da un pesante attacco di sonno...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): All'inizio Battler si unì a lei, e sembrava che ciò avesse rinforzato il loro legame, ma lui quella mattina si era svegliato presto, e man mano fu colto da un attacco di sonno...
Turkish (TR): Görünüşe göre Battler ilk başta Maria'yla aralarındaki bağı güçlendirmek için ona katılmıştı, ama sabah erkenden kalktığı için yavaş yavaş bastıran uyku dalgalarının etkisi altına girmişti...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...Fuaaaaaah..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......fuaaaaaah..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Fuaaaaaah..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……ふぁぁあぁ…。」
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Fuaaaaaah..."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Fuaaaah..."
Turkish (TR): [=UP]

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "Oh, that's a big yawn. Did you get up really early this morning?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh, that's a big yawn. Did you get up really early this morning?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「おや、大きな欠伸だね。朝がずいぶん早かったんじゃないのかい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「おや、大きな欠伸だね。朝がずいぶん早かったんじゃないのかい」
Russian (RU): "О, какой большой зевок. Ты действительно так рано проснулся?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Oh, esse foi um bocejo dos grandes. Acordou cedo essa manhã?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哦呦，打了一個好大的哈欠呀。是不是早上起得太早了啊？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哦呦，打了一个好大的哈欠呀。是不是早上起得太早了啊？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Oh, che sbadiglio grande. Ti sei alzato presto questa mattina?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Oh, che gran sbadiglio. Ti sei alzato molto presto stamattina?"
Turkish (TR): "Oh, bu büyük bir esneme. Bu sabah çok erken mi kalktın?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...Well, something like that. Now that all the tension's gone, I've started getting sleepy while listening to the sound of the rain."
Umineko Project (UP): "...Well, something like that. I started to relax and release all my tension, and then I got sleepy while I was listening to the sound of the rain."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Well, something like that. With all the tension resolved, I started to get sleepy, listening to the sound of the rain."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…まぁ、そんなとこだよ。緊張が解けて、雨の音を聞いてる内に眠くなってきちまった。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…まぁ、そんなとこだよ。緊張が解けて、雨の音を聞いてる内に眠くなってきちまった」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "...Even I only greeted her briefly when she came into the entrance hall. She looked like she was a bit over twenty. I told her my name, but she didn't tell me hers. ...She was being guided by Genji-san, and I saw her go up to the second floor."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Even I only greeted her quickly when she came into the entrance hall. She looked like she was a little over twenty. I told her my name, but she didn't tell me hers. ...She was being guided by Genji‐san, and I saw her go up to the second floor."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Even I only greeted her quickly when she came into the entrance hall. She looked like she was in her twenties. I told her my name, but she didn't tell me hers. ...She was being guided by Genji-san and I saw her go up to the second floor."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……私も、ちょっと玄関ホールに出た時に挨拶をしただけです。二十歳ちょっとくらいに見えたわ。私は名乗ったんだけど、彼女は名乗らなかった。…源次さんに案内されて、二階へ上って行くのを見たの。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……私も、ちょっと玄関ホールに出た時に挨拶をしただけです。二十歳ちょっとくらいに見えたわ。私は名乗ったんだけど、彼女は名乗らなかった。…源次さんに案内されて、二階へ上って行くのを見たの」
Russian (RU): "......Даже я всего лишь быстро поприветствовала её, когда она вошла в вестибюль. На вид ей было где‐то за двадцать. Я представилась ей, но она не представилась в ответ. ...Её сопровождал Генджи‐сан, и я видела, что она поднялась на второй этаж."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu apenas a cumprimentei rapidamente quando ela passou pelo hall de entrada. Ela parecia ter um pouco mais de vinte. Disse a ela meu nome, mas ela não me disse o dela. ...Ela estava acompanhada do Genji‐san, e eu a vi subir para o segundo andar."

PC Japanese (JP): 台風が去って、然るべき場所で証明してみせるまで何も信じられないってことよ。…くすくす。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「台風が去って、然るべき場所で証明してみせるまで何も信じられないってことよ。…くすくす」
Russian (RU): "Так что мы не можем верить чему‐либо, пока не пройдет тайфун, и они не предъявят доказательства в надлежащем месте. *хихикает*."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Até que o tufão passe e seja provado em um local apropriado, não vamos acreditar em nada. ...*risos*."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「在台風過後，到該去的地方讓她給我們證明出來之前，什麼都不能相信。…呵呵。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「在台风过后，到该去的地方让她给我们证明出来之前，什么都不能相信。…呵呵。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi noi non possiamo credere a nulla fino a che il tifone sarà passato e questa persona ci offrirà delle prove nel luogo adeguato. ... *giggle*."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Finché il tifone non sarà passato, e questa persona non ci avrà presentato delle prove in un luogo appropriato, noi non potremo credere a nulla... Uhuhuhuh."
Turkish (TR): "Yani tayfun geçene ve bize bunu uygun yerde kanıtlayana kadar hiçbir şeye inanamayız. ...*giggle*."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "Spotting all kinds of holes in stuff like this is Aneki's specialty. We'll be counting on you."
Umineko Project (UP): "Constantly finding fault like that is your speciality, Aneki. This is gonna be all down to you."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Recklessly finding fault in that kind of thing is Aneki's specialty. We'll be counting on you."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そういうので揚げ足を取り捲るのは姉貴の得意技だな。任せるぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そういうので揚げ足を取り捲るのは姉貴の得意技だな。任せるぜ」
Russian (RU): "Лихо находить изъян в подобных вещах — конёк Анеки. Мы рассчитываем на тебя."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É sua especialidade ficar achando falhas em coisas assim, aneki. Estamos contando com você."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「在這種地方挑刺兒挑個遍，可真是大姐的拿手絕學啊。就交給大姐了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「在这种地方挑刺儿挑个遍，可真是大姐的拿手绝学啊。就交给大姐了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Trovare cavilli in questo genere di cose è la tua specialità. Contiamo su di te."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Trovare cavilli di ogni tipo è la tua specialità, sorellona. Contiamo su di te."
Turkish (TR): "Bu gibi şeylerde her türlü açığı tespit etmek senin uzmanlık alanın, Aneki. Sana güveniyoruz."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "Are you joking? You'll be helping too. ...We need the money. We need it quickly, and a large sum! Our fates are all tied together in this.
Umineko Project (UP): "Are you an idiot? You'll be helping too. ......We need money. And quickly, and a large sum! We're all in this together."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Are you an idiot? You'll be helping too. ......We need money. And quickly, and a large sum! We're all in this together.
PC Japanese (JP): 「馬鹿言ってんじゃないわよ。あんたも協力するのよ。……私たちにはお金がいる。それも急ぎ、まとまった額が！　私たちは運命共同体よ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「馬鹿言ってんじゃないわよ。あんたも協力するのよ。……私たちにはお金がいる。それも急ぎ、まとまった額が！　私たちは運命共同体よ」
Russian (RU): "Ты что, идиот? Ты тоже будешь помогать. ......Нам нужны деньги. Очень срочно и большая сумма! Мы тут все в одной лодке."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você é idiota? Você vai ajudar também. ......Precisamos de dinheiro. Rápido, em uma grande quantia! Estamos todos no mesmo barco."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「別給我說蠢話。你也是要來幫忙的啊。……我們都需要錢。而且是急需，數額巨大！我們可是綁在一根繩上的螞蚱喲。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「别给我说蠢话。你也是要来帮忙的啊。……我们都需要钱。而且是急需，数额巨大！我们可是绑在一根绳上的蚂蚱哟。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sei stupido? Anche tu mi aiuterai. ... Abbiamo bisogno di denaro. E presto, e in grande quantità! Ci siamo dentro tutti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Stai scherzando? Anche tu darai una mano... Abbiamo bisogno di denaro.{n}Ci serve subito, e in gran quantità! Siamo tutti nella stessa barca..."
Turkish (TR): "Aptal mısın sen? Sen de yardım edeceksin. ......Paraya ihtiyacımız var. Çabuk ve büyük miktarda! Bu işte hepimiz beraberiz."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): ......As if we'd just stand by and let some suddenly-appearing mystery woman destroy the inheritance we're after...!"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........There's no way I'm having my prospects of an inheritance destroyed now by some mystery woman who popped out of nowhere...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........As if we could just stand by and let a mystery woman, who appeared unexpectedly in a place like this, destroy our goal, the inheritance...!"
PC Japanese (JP): ………こんなところでひょっこり現れた謎の女に、遺産のアテをブチ壊されて堪るもんですか…！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………こんなところでひょっこり現れた謎の女に、遺産のアテをブチ壊されて堪るもんですか…！」
Russian (RU): ".........Как будто мы просто будем стоять в стороне и позволим этой таинственной женщине, объявившейся здесь неизвестно откуда, разрушить наши планы с наследством!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Como se pudéssemos ficar parados enquanto uma mulher misteriosa aparece e destrói a herança que estamos atrás...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………哪能容忍在這種地方突然冒出來的謎一樣的女人，把我們指望著的遺產搞砸啊…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………哪能容忍在这种地方突然冒出来的谜一样的女人，把我们指望着的遗产搞砸啊…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Come se potessimo restare fermi e lasciare che una donna misteriosa, apparsa all'improvviso in questo posto, distrugga il nostro obiettivo, l'eredità...!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Non possiamo tollerare che una donna misteriosa apparsa qui all'improvviso rovini le nostre mire all'eredità...!"
Turkish (TR): ".........Birdenbire ortaya çıkan gizemli bir kadın tarafından miras beklentimin yok edilmesine izin veremem...!"

Steam (ST): Rudolf and Eva always formed a united front as siblings at times like this, sickened by the idea that their own inheritance might be snatched away by an outsider.
Umineko Project (UP): It was only at a time like this that Rudolf and Eva united as siblings, sickened by the idea that their own inheritance might be snatched away by an outsider.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rudolf and Eva always grew united as siblings in times like these, sickened by the idea that their own inheritance might be snatched away by an outsider.
PC Japanese (JP): 留弗夫と絵羽の夫婦は、自分たちの遺産を余所者に掻っ攫われて堪るかと、こんな時ばかり兄弟で結束するのだった。
Russian (RU): Подстёгиваемые мыслями о том, что их наследство может отобрать чужак, Ева с Рудольфом всегда объединялись как сестра и брат в подобные моменты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas em momentos como esse que Rudolf e Eva se uniam como irmãos, enjoados pela ideia de que uma estranha poderia passar a mão em suas heranças.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 留弗夫和繪羽夫婦，都擺出了一副無法容忍屬於自己的遺產被外人奪走的態度，唯獨在這種時候兄妹團結在了一起。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 留弗夫和绘羽夫妇，都摆出了一副无法容忍属于自己的遗产被外人夺走的态度，唯独在这种时候兄妹团结在了一起。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rudolf ed Eva si alleavano sempre in questo tipo di occasioni, seccati dal fatto che l'eredità, loro di diritto, potesse essere portata via da un'estranea.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sia Rudolf che Eva, in quanto fratelli, si alleavano sempre in circostanze del genere, non potendo sopportare che la loro eredità venisse portata via da un'estranea.
Turkish (TR): Rudolf ve Eva ancak böyle bir zamanda kardeş olarak birleşmişti, ve kendi miraslarının bir yabancı tarafından ellerinden alınabileceği fikri midelerini bulandırıyordu.

Steam (ST): Kyrie noticed how indomitable they looked, shook her head slightly, and gave a small sigh as she gazed out the window.
Umineko Project (UP): Kyrie noticed how indomitable they looked, shook her head slightly, and gave a small sigh as she looked out the window.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kyrie noticed how indomitable they looked, swung her head slightly to the side, and gave a small sigh as she looked out the window.
PC Japanese (JP): 霧江はその逞しい様子を見て、軽く首を横に振り、小さなため息を漏らしながら外を見た。
Russian (RU): Заметив их неукротимый настрой, Кирие, слегка покачав головой, взглянула в окно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kyrie percebeu o quão indômitos os irmãos pareciam, e balançando levemente sua cabeça, ela suspirou enquanto olhava pela janela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 霧江看著這勁頭十足的樣子，輕輕搖了搖頭，小口嘆著氣望向了外面。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 雾江看着这劲头十足的样子，轻轻摇了摇头，小口叹着气望向了外面。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kyrie notò la loro aria risoluta, inclinò un po' la testa di lato, e sospirò guardando fuori dalla finestra.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Notando la loro aria risoluta, Kirie piegò leggermente la testa di lato e fece un piccolo sospiro, guardando fuori dalla finestra nel mentre.
Turkish (TR): Kyrie onların ne kadar azimli göründüklerini fark edince başını hafifçe salladı ve pencereden dışarı bakarken küçük bir iç geçirdi.

Steam (ST): Outside, it was still raining heavily, and everything was gray, having lost all vibrance.
Umineko Project (UP): Outside, there was still a strong rain falling, and everything was gray, having lost all vibrance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Outside, there was still a strong rain falling, and everything was gray, having lost all vibrance.
PC Japanese (JP): 外は相変わらず強い雨が降っていて、全てが灰色になり精彩を欠いていた。
Russian (RU): Снаружи дождь лил как из ведра, и всё выглядело серым, растеряв былые краски.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Do lado de fora, a chuva caía cada vez mais forte, e tudo estava cinza, tendo perdido toda a intensidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 外面依舊下著猛烈的大雨，一切都變成了灰色，失去了光彩。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 外面依旧下着猛烈的大雨，一切都变成了灰色，失去了光彩。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Fuori, la pioggia era ancora forte, e tutto era grigio, avendo perso tutto il suo splendore.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Fuori la pioggia batteva ancora forte, e tutto era grigio e privo di vita.
Turkish (TR): Dışarıda hâlâ şiddetli bir yağmur yağıyordu ve her şey tüm canlılığını yitirmiş olarak gri renge bürünmüştü.

Steam (ST): The lush garden that the sun had shone on earlier now felt like a lie.
Umineko Project (UP): It felt like the lush garden that the sun had shone on earlier had never existed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It felt like the lush garden that the sun had shone on earlier had been no more than a lie.
PC Japanese (JP): かつて太陽が照らし、青々とした庭園を見せてくれていたことがまるで嘘だったかのように感じさせる。
Russian (RU): Казалось, словно пышный сад, ранее освещавшийся солнцем, был всего лишь иллюзией.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era como se o exuberante jardim onde o sol havia brilhado mais cedo, nunca tivesse existido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓人感覺到那曾被太陽照耀得，呈現出綠意洋洋一面的庭園，簡直就像是一場謊言。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让人感觉到那曾被太阳照耀得，呈现出绿意洋洋一面的庭园，简直就像是一场谎言。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembrava che lo stupendo giardino su cui il sole aveva brillato prima, fosse stato solo un illusione.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Il giardino stupendo, che in precedenza era baciato dal sole, sembrava come se in realtà non fosse mai esistito.
Turkish (TR): Sanki daha önce güneşin parlattığı yemyeşil bahçe hiç var olmamış gibiydi.

Steam (ST): For some reason, the words Eva said a second ago kept repeating in Kyrie's head.
Umineko Project (UP): For some reason, the words Eva had said just a short while ago kept repeating in Kyrie's head.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For some reason, the words Eva had said just a short while ago kept repeating in Kyrie's head.
PC Japanese (JP): 霧江は、なぜか先ほど絵羽が口にした言葉を頭の中で繰り返していた。
Russian (RU): По какой‐то причине сказанные Евой слова продолжали повторяться в голове у Кирие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por alguma razão, as palavras que Eva havia dito há pouco ainda se repetiam na cabeça de Kyrie.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 霧江不知為何，在腦中重複回放著剛才繪羽說出口的話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 雾江不知为何，在脑中重复回放着刚才绘羽说出口的话。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per qualche ragione, le parole che Eva aveva pronunciato poco prima continuavano a ripetersi nella testa di Kyrie.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per qualche ragione, nella testa di Kirie risuonavano le parole pronunciate da Eva poco prima...
Turkish (TR): Nedense Eva'nın kısa bir süre önce söylediği sözler Kyrie'nin kafasında tekrarlanıp duruyordu.

Steam (ST): ...So, in other words, it's something like this. No matter what's shown to us now on Rokkenjima, it can't be accepted as truth.
Umineko Project (UP): .........It boils down to this. No matter what is shown to us now on Rokkenjima, it can't be accepted as truth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, in other words, it's something like this. No matter what is shown to us now on Rokkenjima, it can't be accepted as truth.
PC Japanese (JP): ………つまりこういうことよ。今の六軒島では、何が示されても真実だと受け容れることはできない。
Russian (RU): То есть, другими словами, расклад таков. Что бы нам ни показали на Роккенджиме, это нельзя принять за правду.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Ou seja, se resume a: não importa o que ela mostre para nós aqui em Rokkenjima, não podemos aceitar como verdade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………也就是說是這麼回事。在現在的六軒島上，無論出示了什麼都無法當成真實去接受。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………也就是说是这么回事。在现在的六轩岛上，无论出示了什么都无法当成真实去接受。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, in altri termini, la situazione è questa. Non importa cosa ci venga mostrata adesso, qui su Rokkenjima, non potrà comunque essere accettata come la verità.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...‘In breve, la situazione è questa: non importa cosa ci verrà mostrato ora a Rokkenjima, non lo accetteremo mai come vero’.
Turkish (TR): .........İşin özü şu: Şu anda Rokkenjima'da bize ne gösterilirse gösterilsin, gerçek olarak kabul edilemez.

Steam (ST): There was an odd nuance to those words.
Umineko Project (UP): There was an odd nuance to those words.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There was an odd nuance to those words.
PC Japanese (JP): 不思議な語感の言葉だった。
Russian (RU): В этих словах скрывался какой‐то странный нюанс.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia um estranho nuance naquelas palavras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是句有著奇妙語感的話語。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是句有着奇妙语感的话语。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): C'era qualcosa di insolito in quelle parole.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): [=ITA]
Turkish (TR): Bu sözlerde garip bir nüans vardı.

Steam (ST): At that moment, the island was closed off by the typhoon and isolated. They had access to no public institutions and no hospital.
Umineko Project (UP): Right now, this island was closed off by the typhoon and isolated.{n}There were no official institutions here, and no hospital.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Right now, this island was closed off by the typhoon and isolated. They had no official connections and no hospital.
PC Japanese (JP): 今のこの島は、台風に閉ざされ孤立している。公的機関も病院もない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 今のこの島は、台風に閉ざされ孤立している。{n}公的機関も病院もない。
Russian (RU): Прямо сейчас, этот остров был отрезан и изолирован тайфуном от окружающего мира.{n}На данный момент они не имели возможности связаться с официальными учреждениями и больницей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora, esta ilha foi fechada pelo tufão e está isolada.{n}Não existem instituições públicas aqui, nem mesmo um hospital.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 現在這座島，被封閉在了台風之中，孤立無援。{n}沒有公共機構也沒有醫院。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 现在这座岛，被封闭在了台风之中，孤立无援。{n}没有公共机构也没有医院。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In quel frangente, l'isola era tagliata fuori dal mondo grazie al tifone e inaccessibile. Non potevano contattare nessuno e non disponevano di un ospedale.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): In quel frangente, l'isola era stata isolata da un tifone, ed era inaccessibile.{n}Lì non c'erano strutture pubbliche, e nemmeno ospedali.
Turkish (TR): Şu anda bu ada tayfun tarafından kapatılmış ve izole edilmiş durumdaydı.{n}Burada herhangi bir resmi kurum ya da hastane yoktu.

Steam (ST): So on this island, no matter what manner of proof related to the outside world was shown, it would always be possible to call it a lie. It would be impossible to prove that something was the truth.
Umineko Project (UP): So, no matter what institution had issued what kind of documentation, on this island, one could claim that it was all fiction. It was impossible to prove that something was the truth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So on this island, no matter what manner of proof with any relation to the outside world was shown, one could claim that it was fiction. It was impossible to prove that something was the truth.
PC Japanese (JP): だからこの島では、どんな機関が発行した証明書を見せようとも、全て虚偽だと言い張れる。真実を証明することが不可能なのだ。
Russian (RU): Поэтому любое предъявленное на этом острове доказательство, имеющее какое‐либо отношение ко внешнему миру, могло быть объявлено фикцией. То есть невозможно было доказать, что что‐либо являлось правдой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, nesta ilha, não importa quem tenha emitido qualquer tipo de documentação, é sempre possível afirmar que tudo não passa de uma falácia.{n}Era impossível provar que qualquer coisa fosse verdade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以在這座島上，無論是把哪個機關部門發行的證明書拿出來給人看，全都可以被硬說成是假的。要證明真實是不可能的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以在这座岛上，无论是把哪个机关部门发行的证明书拿出来给人看，全都可以被硬说成是假的。要证明真实是不可能的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dunque su quest'isola, chiunque avrebbe potuto etichettare come falsa qualsiasi prova che fosse collegata al mondo esterno. Era impossibile provare che quale fosse la verità.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per cui, in quest'isola si poteva asserire che qualsiasi attestato mostrato potesse essere falso, a prescindere da quale organizzazione fosse stato rilasciato. Dimostrare la verità era qualcosa di impossibile.
Turkish (TR): Dolayısıyla, hangi kurum ne tür bir belge yayınlamış olursa olsun, bu adada bunların hepsinin kurgu olduğu iddia edilebilirdi. Bir şeyin gerçek olduğunu kanıtlamak imkansızdı.

Steam (ST): Now that they were isolated from the outside, all truths whose proof lay in the outside world would be called "lies"...
Umineko Project (UP): They were cut off from the outside world, and all truths proven in the outside world would be called "fiction"...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They were cut off from the outside world, and any truth that must be proven in the outside world would be called 'fiction'...
PC Japanese (JP): 外界と途絶し、外界で証明された全ての真実が「虚偽」と呼ばれてしまう…。
Russian (RU): Из‐за отрезанности от внешнего мира любая правда, требующая доказательства во внешнем мире, может быть объявлена "фикцией"...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora que eles estão isolados do mundo, todas as verdades produzidas fora daqui seriam chamadas de "falácia"...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此處和外界隔絕，在外界受到證明的所有真實，都會被稱為「虛假」…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此处和外界隔绝，在外界受到证明的所有真实，都会被称为「虚假」…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Erano tagliati fuori dal mondo esterno, e ogni verità che necessitasse di essere confermata nel mondo esterno sarebbe stata etichettata come ‘finzione’...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Erano tagliati fuori dal mondo esterno, ed ogni verità confermabile nel mondo esterno sarebbe stata etichettata come {i:menzogna}...
Turkish (TR): Dış dünyayla bağlantıları kesilmişti ve dış dünyada kanıtlanan tüm gerçekler "kurgu" olarak nitelendirilecekti...

Steam (ST): So does that mean... ...that right now, on this Rokkenjima, no truth exists at all?
Umineko Project (UP): So did that mean......that now, on this Rokkenjima, there was nothing that was truthful?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So did that mean, ......that now, on this Rokkenjima, there was nothing that was truthful?

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que significa que......agora, nesta Rokkenjima, não existem verdades?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這也就是說。……現在的六軒島上，根本沒有什麼真實嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这也就是说。……现在的六轩岛上，根本没有什么真实吗？

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Questo significava che... in quel momento, a Rokkenjima non esisteva nulla che potesse essere veritiero...?

Steam (ST): ...Does it mean that everything will now be ruled by "lies" alone?
Umineko Project (UP): ......That everything would be controlled by "fiction"?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......That everything would be controlled by 'fiction'?

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……只有「虚假」支配着一切吗？

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Che la {i:menzogna} fosse l'unica forza dominante?

Steam (ST): It almost gives the illusion... ...that we've left the human world of truth... ...and have been shut away inside another world, one of lies.
Umineko Project (UP): It almost gave the illusion......that separate from the human world made from truth...was another world called fiction, in which they had been shut away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It almost gave the illusion, ......that separate from the human world made from truth, ...was another world called fiction, in which they had been shut away.
PC Japanese (JP): それはまるで、……真実で作られた人間の世界から、…虚偽という異界に切り離されたような錯覚。
Russian (RU): Казалось, словно помимо мира людей, созданного из правды, существовал ещё один мир, называющийся вымыслом, в который они оказались заперты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso produzia a ilusão de que......fomos separados do mundo humano da verdade...e fomos presos no mundo da ficção, em um mundo de falácias.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這簡直能讓人誤以為，……此處已從真實做成的人類世界切離了開來，…掉進了名為虛假的異界。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这简直能让人误以为，……此处已从真实做成的人类世界切离了开来，…掉进了名为虚假的异界。

Steam (ST): ...Kyrie remembered that woman's appearance one more time.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Kyrie remembered what that woman had looked like one more time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): On this island, which has been cut off from the world of humans and shut away in the world of nonhumans, ...a nonhuman being has come to visit.
Umineko Project (UP): On this island, which had been isolated from the world of humans, and shut away in the world of nonhumans, ......a nonhuman being had visited.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On this island, which had been isolated from the world of humans, and shut away in the world of nonhumans, ......a nonhuman being had visited.
PC Japanese (JP): 人の世から隔絶し、人ならざる世に切り離された島に、……人ならざる世の存在が訪れる。
Russian (RU): Этот остров, отрезанный и изолированный от мира людей, запертый в мире нелюдей, посетило создание, не являющееся человеком.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesta ilha, que foi isolada do mundo humanos, e trancafiada no mundo dos não‐humanos, ......um ser não‐humano veio fazer uma visita.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 孤立於人的世界，被切離進了非人世界的這座島上，……來了個非人世界的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 孤立于人的世界，被切离进了非人世界的这座岛上，……来了个非人世界的存在。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): In quell'isola, separata dal mondo degli umani e finita in quello dei non umani... era giunta una creatura inumana.

Steam (ST): Kyrie couldn't think of the smile that had appeared on that woman's face...as anything other than a portent of misfortune...
Umineko Project (UP): No matter what she did, Kyrie couldn't help think of the smile that had appeared on that woman's face as anything other than ominous......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No matter what she did, Kyrie couldn't help think of that smile that had appeared on that woman's face as anything other than a thing of misfortune......
PC Japanese (JP): 霧江には、どうしてもあの女の浮かべた笑みが、不吉なものに思えてならないのだった……。
Russian (RU): И улыбка, промелькнувшая на лице той женщины. Кирие никак не могла отделаться от мысли, что эта улыбка является предвестницей большой беды...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kyrie não conseguia evitar de pensar no sorriso que surgiu no rosto daquela mulher, como se fosse o auspício de um mau agouro......

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Kirie non riusciva a fare a meno di pensare a quanto fosse sinistro il sorriso comparso sul volto di quella donna...

Steam (ST): I get the feeling my chessboard thinking's missed a vital premise, ...one that'll be necessary to understand that misfortune-bearing smile.
Umineko Project (UP): In trying to understand that ominous smile, ...it feels like my chessboard thinking mistook a vital premise.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It feels like my chessboard thinking mistook a vital premise, ...now that I try to understand that smile of misfortune.
PC Japanese (JP): あの不吉な笑みを理解するのに、…私のチェス盤思考は大きな前提を間違えている気がする。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tentando compreender aquele sorriso agourento, ...sinto que minha forma de pensar com tabuleiro está esquecendo de uma premissa vital.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 感覺，如果要理解那笑容，…我的國際象棋盤思維還搞錯了一個大前提。

Turkish (TR): o uğursuz gülümsemeyi anlamaya çalışırken, ...satranç tahtası düşüncem kritik bir noktayı yanlış yorumlamış gibi hissediyorum.

Steam (ST): ...Yes, that smile made me feel as though someone inhuman was mocking me. I've based my reasoning on the assumption that our opponent is a "human" like us.
Umineko Project (UP): ...That's right, that smile seemed like that of something nonhuman looking down on me. I had reasoned based on the assumption that our opponent was a "human" like us.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...That's right, that smile seemed like that of something not human looking down on me. I have reasoned based on the assumption that my opponent was a 'human' like us.
PC Japanese (JP): …そう、あの笑みは、人ならざる者が見下すかのようだった。私は相手を、自分たちと同じ「人間」だと仮定して推理した。
Russian (RU): ...Точно, от той улыбки я ощутила, будто на меня сверху вниз смотрит не человек. В своих рассуждениях я руководствовалась допущением, что мой противник является таким же человеком, как "мы".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Sim, aquele sorriso fez com que eu sentisse que algo que não era humano estivesse me menosprezando. Eu baseei meu raciocínio na suposição de que nossa oponente era uma "humana" como nós.

Chinese Simplified (CN): …对，那笑容，就好像是非人之者在傲世轻物一般。我是把对手假定成了与我们同样的「人类」而做出的推理。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Già, il suo sorriso sembrava quello di un essere sovrannaturale, che mi guardava dall'alto in basso. Ho ragionato basandomi sul presupposto che l'avversario fosse {i:umano} come noi...
Turkish (TR): ...Doğru, o gülümseme sanki insan olmayan bir şeyin bana tepeden bakışına benziyordu. Rakibimizin de bizim gibi bir "insan" olduğu varsayımına dayanarak mantık yürütmüştüm.

Steam (ST): ...However, just like this island is now, she may be a being that isn't human, and human values may not matter to her.
Umineko Project (UP): ......However, just like this island now, she may be a being that is not human, and human values may not apply to her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......However, just like this island now, she may be a being that is not human, and human values may not matter for her.

Russian (RU): ......Вот только совсем как этот остров сейчас, она может оказаться не являющимся человеком созданием, на которое не распространяются человеческие ценности.

Umineko Project (UP): In that case.........all reasoning is useless.{n}For what reason was the witch invited here today?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that case.........all reasoning is useless. For what reason has the witch been invited here today?

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa

Steam (ST): The strength of the strokes, the thickness of the lines, how clean the shape was. ...By itself, it wasn't enough to guess the background of the person who had written it, but it was enough for Rosa to be sure that it was someone older than Maria.
Umineko Project (UP): The strength of the strokes, the thickness of the lines, how clean the shape was.{n}......This by itself wasn't enough to guess the background of the person who had drawn it, but it was enough for Rosa to understand that it was definitely someone older than Maria.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The strength of the strokes, the thickness of the lines, how clean the shape was.......This by itself wasn't enough to guess the background of the person who had written it, but it was enough for Rosa to understand that it was definitely someone older than Maria.
PC Japanese (JP): 筆圧や線の太さ、図形の綺麗さ。……これだけから書いた人間の素性を推し量ることはできないが、確実に真里亞より年齢の高い人物が書いたことは理解できる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 筆圧や線の太さ、図形の綺麗さ。{n}……これだけから書いた人間の素性を推し量ることはできないが、確実に真里亞より年齢の高い人物が書いたことは理解できる。
Russian (RU): Сила нажатия, толщина линий, наличие идеальной формы.{n}......Одних этих деталей было недостаточно для получения полного представления об авторе рисунка, но достаточно, что бы Роза поняла — круг определённо нарисовал кто‐то старше Марии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A força dos traços, a grossura das linhas, o quão limpo as formas eram.{n}......Isto por si só não era suficiente para adivinhar a experiência da pessoa que havia desenhado, mas era suficiente para Rosa entender que definitivamente foi alguém mais velho que Maria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 落筆的勁道、線的粗細、圖形的工整度。{n}……雖然光靠此無法猜測出作畫之人的秉性，但確實是能讓人明白，這圖形是年紀比真里亞大的人畫的。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): When I was young, I was terrified of the witch, unlike Maria. So for me, the name {f:5:Beatrice} was a synonym for terror.
Umineko Project (UP): When I was a young girl, unlike Maria, I was very frightened of witches.{n}So for me, the name {f:5:Beatrice} was a synonym for something frightening.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I was a young girl, unlike Maria, I was very frightened of the witch. So for me, the name Beatrice was a synonym for something frightening.
PC Japanese (JP): 少女時代の私は、真里亞と違い、魔女の存在を強く恐れた。だから、私にとってベアトリーチェの名は恐ろしいものの代名詞だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 少女時代の私は、真里亞と違い、魔女の存在を強く恐れた。{n}だから、私にとってベアトリーチェの名は恐ろしいものの代名詞だった。
Russian (RU): Когда я была юной девочкой, то в отличие от Марии я очень боялась ведьмы.{n}Поэтому для меня имя {f:5:Беатриче} всегда было синонимом чего‐то очень страшного.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando eu era uma jovem garota, diferente da Maria, eu tinha muito medo de bruxas. Então, para mim, o nome {f:5:Beatrice} era sinônimo de algo aterrorizante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 少女時代的我，和真里亞不一樣，非常害怕魔女。{n}因此對我來說，貝阿朵莉切的名字就是恐怖的代名詞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 少女时代的我，和真里亚不一样，非常害怕魔女。{n}因此对我来说，贝阿朵莉切的名字就是恐怖的代名词。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando ero piccola, al contrario di Maria, ero terrorizzata dalla strega.{n}Quindi per me, il nome ‘{f:5:Beatrice}’ era sinonimo di qualcosa di spaventoso...
Turkish (TR): Ben genç bir kızken, Maria'nın aksine, cadılardan çok korkardım.{n}Yani benim için {f:5:Beatrice} ismi dehşet verici bir şeyle eş anlamlıydı.

Steam (ST): ......Surely, my fear from those days has been revived by the appearance of a woman going by that name...
Umineko Project (UP): ......So it must be that my feeling of fear from my days as a young girl has been revived, because a woman calling herself that has appeared...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......So surely, my feeling of fear from my days as a young girl has been revived because a woman calling herself that has appeared...
PC Japanese (JP): ……だから、それを名乗る女が現れたため、少女時代の恐怖感が蘇ってしまったに違いない…。
Russian (RU): ......И наверняка воспоминания о том пугающем чувстве ожили вновь, когда появилась женщина, называющая себя так...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......De repente, meu medo durante meus dias de criança foi revivido por causa da aparição de uma mulher com o mesmo nome...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……所以，一定是由於出現了自稱貝阿朵莉切的女人，而使我少女時代的恐懼感甦醒了…。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perciò, l'apparizione di quella donna che si faceva chiamare in quel modo, sicuramente aveva fatto sì che le paure di quando ero una ragazzina si fossero risvegliate...

Umineko Project (UP): ......She couldn't be a witch. ......She's obviously a {i:human} calling herself {f:5:Beatrice}, right?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......She couldn't be a witch.......She's obviously a 'human' calling herself Beatrice, right?

Umineko Project (UP): Oh, yes... ......That witch entrusted me with an envelope... What in the world could that be?

Steam (ST): Rosa pulled that Western envelope out of her pocket.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa pulled that Western envelope out of her pocket.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa pulled that western-style envelope out of her pocket.

Steam (ST): ...It was one of the envelopes that bore the Ushiromiya family crest, which Kinzo used for his personal letters. ...And its red sealing wax had even been sealed by the Head's Ring, which Kinzo held.
Umineko Project (UP): ...It was the Western envelope which bore the Ushiromiya crest which Kinzo used on his personal letters. ......And it had even been sealed with the red sealing wax by the Head's Ring, which Kinzo held.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It was the western-style envelope which bore the Ushiromiya family crest, which Kinzo used on his personal letters.......And it had even been sealed with the red sealing wax by the Head's Ring, which Kinzo held.
PC Japanese (JP): …それは、金蔵が親書に使う右代宮家の紋章をあしらった洋形封筒。……そして赤い封蝋には、金蔵が持つ当主の指輪による封印までされている。
Russian (RU): ...Это был западный конверт, носивший на себе фамильный герб семьи Уширомия, который Кинзо использовал для своих личных писем. ......И он даже был запечатан красным воском с печатью главы, которую Кинзо держал при себе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Era o envelope ocidental que carregava consigo o brasão da família Ushiromiya que Kinzo usava em suas cartas pessoais. ......E ele havia sido, inclusive, selado com cera vermelha, usando o Anel do Chefe, que pertencia a Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …這西式信封上，配著會在金藏的親筆信上使用的右代宮家家徽。……而且那紅色的封蠟，還印上了用金藏手上的當主戒指蓋的印記。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …这西式信封上，配着会在金藏的亲笔信上使用的右代宫家家徽。……而且那红色的封蜡，还印上了用金藏手上的当主戒指盖的印记。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Era la lettera che portava il simbolo della famiglia Ushiromiya, che Kinzo usava nelle sue lettere personali. ... Ed era stata chiusa con il sigillo in ceralacca rosso dall'anello del capofamiglia, che possedeva Kinzo.

Turkish (TR): ...Bu, Kinzo'nun kişisel mektuplarında kullandığı Ushiromiya armasını taşıyan Batı tarzı zarfıydı. ......Ve hatta Kinzo'nun elinde bulunan Aile Reisi Yüzüğü tarafından kırmızı balmumuyla mühürlenmişti.

Steam (ST): ......Which meant...this envelope belonged to the Ushiromiya Family Head. ...In other words, it was from Father.

Steam (ST): Why was a woman calling herself {f:5:Beatrice} holding it, and why did she give it to me?
Umineko Project (UP): Why was a woman calling herself {f:5:Beatrice} holding it, and why did she give it to me?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Why was a woman calling herself Beatrice holding it, and why did she give it to me?

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perché la portava con sé una donna che si faceva chiamare {f:5:Beatrice}, e perché l'aveva consegnata a me?

Steam (ST): That's right, I'm sure she said to read this aloud at dinner. ......What in the world could be written inside...?

Steam (ST): A sense of uncertainty gripped Rosa, as if opening this envelope might let loose incredible misfortune...
Umineko Project (UP): Anxiety gripped Rosa, as if opening this envelope might release some kind of monumental disaster...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): An uncertainty gripped Rosa, as if opening this envelope would release a ridiculous object of misfortune...
PC Japanese (JP): この封筒を開けることによって、何かとんでもない不吉なものを解放してしまうのではないかという不安が楼座を襲う…。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不安侵襲著樓座。總覺得打開了這個信封，就好像會解放出什麼了不得的不吉之物似的…。

Steam (ST): ...However, at the same time, a little curiosity sprouted up too, urging her to find out what was written inside before the other siblings could.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
